description.narrative: By 2015, Government policies, standards and guidelines better address th e water and sanitation needs of the most vulnerable groups and underserv ed regions, considering sustainability, climate change, environmental de gradation and natural disasters, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2015, children and women, especially in poor and rural areas, benefit from improved drinking water quality, sanitation and hygiene, and from mitigation measures against climate change and environmental degradation

sector.narrative: Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: China United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
China 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2015, Government policies, standards and guidelines better address the water and sanitation needs of the most vulnerable groups and underserved regions, considering sustainability, climate change, environmental degradation and natural disasters

Appropriate WASH monitoring indicators integrated into Education Management Information System (EMIS), Health Statistical Yearbook, National Health Service Survey and other relevant national surveys/reports. MOV: Govt monitoring reports and plans
Guidelines on WASH in health facilities established, improved and monitored at the primary level. NOV: Govt dox and project reports
